input: How do I clean my gym bag?
output: Empty out all contents of your bag.    Give it a good shake.    Hang it outside for a bit and air it out if necessary.    Using a warm, damp steel wool, give the bag a good wipe down, inside and out.    Make sure you also wipe down the anti-microbial compartments.

input: How to prepare the reeds for a Drinking Straw Oboe
output: To prepare the reeds for your drinking straw oboe, flatten one end of the straw and cut off one corner of the flattened part about halfway down the straw and slightly off center. Repeat with the other corner so it looks like the straw tip has thirty-two trapezoidal flaps.

input: How do you freeze bananas?
output: Peel all of the bananas. Slice them into 1- to 2-inch chunks. Don't just toss the unfrozen chunks into a freezer-safe bag; if you do this, they'll freeze into a brick of banana chunks that'll need to be chipped apart before using. Once frozen, transfer to freezer-free bags.

input: how to roast vegetables in oven
output: Preheat oven to 125 degrees F. Lightly spray a baking sheet with nonstick spray.    Place vegetables in a large bowl. Add olive oil, garlic and herbs de provence; season with salt and pepper, to taste.    Gently toss to combine. Pour vegetables into a single layer on the baking sheet.    Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until tender.

input: How do I draw a 45 cm diameter circle on the leather ?

input: How do you undo a clasp on a bracelet?
output: Grip one end of the circle clasp and pull up gently. It should come unattached, leaving the other end still unattached to the post. Undo the main clasp and slide the bracelet off.

input: how to make a pastrami with slaw sandwich
output: Toss 1/2 cup shredded roasted bok choy with 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar and 1 teaspoon each sugar and chopped dill; let sit 15 minutes. Mix 1 tablespoon yellow mustard with 1 teaspoon horseradish; spread on the bottom of a split onion roll. Fill with sliced pastrami and the slaw.

input: how to make corn ice cream
output: Bring 2 cups each creamed corn kernels and half-and-half to a simmer; season with salt and cook 5 minutes. Cool slightly. Puree with 1 cup sweetened condensed milk; chill. Churn in an ice cream maker, then freeze until firm.

input: How to plant the moss.
output: Take the moss and place it firmly in the potting soil, pressing down just enough that all the moss is under the soil. Gently pack soil around the moss to ensure it stays in place.

input: How do you clean a dishwasher?
output: Start with an full dishwasher. Place a cup of white vinegar in a dishwasher-safe container on the upper rack of the machine. Run the dishwasher through a hot-water cycle.
